articles.description: Thomas Tuchel criticises England's "attitude" and feels they "played with fire" in a narrow 1-0 World Cup qualifying win away to Andorra.
articles.title: England: Thomas Tuchel criticises his side's attitude in narrow Andorra win

articles.description: Coco Gauff has finally become the French Open champion, going from tears of pain to tears of joy in Paris. This is how she did it.
articles.title: French Open 2025: Coco Gauff goes from tears of pain to tears of joy at Roland Garros

articles.description: England have started the summer by thrashing a depleted West Indies side - but what does it mean for the team's post-Ashes rebuild and World Cup hopes?
articles.title: England women's cricket: Four talking points from Charlotte Edwards and Nat Sciver-Brunt's first series

articles.description: Manchester City are on the verge of completing a £31m deal to sign left-back Rayan Ait-Nouri from Wolves.
articles.title: Rayan Ait-Nouri: Manchester City on verge on completing £31m deal for Wolves left-back

articles.description: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo says he will not play at the Club World Cup after rejecting offers from participating teams.
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo rejects offers to play at Club World Cup

articles.description: Chelsea are in talks to sign Borussia Dortmund's Jamie Gittens and have offered the winger a seven-year contract.
articles.title: Jamie Gittens: Chelsea in talks to sign Borussia Dortmund winger

articles.description: World number two Rory McIlroy says he is "concerned" about his form heading into the US Open after struggling with his driver at the Canadian Open.
articles.title: Rory McIlroy 'concerned' for US Open after driver issues at Canadian Open

articles.description: Olympic champion Simone Biles calls former US swimmer and activist Riley Gaines "sick" over online comments about a transgender woman softball player.
articles.title: Simone Biles calls former US swimmer Riley Gaines 'sick' in trans rights row

articles.description: Leinster overpower Glasgow Warriors to oust the reigning champions and ease into the United Rugby Championship final.
articles.title: Leinster 37-19 Glasgow: Six-try hosts beat holders to reach URC final

articles.description: Coco Gauff wins the first French Open singles title of her career by fighting back to beat world number one Aryna Sabalenka in a rollercoaster final.
articles.title: French Open 2025: Coco Gauff beats Aryna Sabalenka to win first Roland Garros title
